column4: hi, my flashplugin-nonfree is in the newest version but firefox still says i dont have the latest flash
flashplugin-nonfree is an older but somewhat more stable version of flasg
are you using the 64-bit version of ubuntu?
what response do you get from uname -m?
then you have the 32-bit version
sorry then. so i cant get the new flash?
you could try downloading the .tar.gz, extracting it, then moving the libflashplayer.so into the mozilla/firefox plugins directory
the 32-bit version of flash is less buggy that the 64-bit build and is still kept up-to-date
im going to try extracting the file and putting it into the firefox plugins directory. see if that works
i moved libflashplayer.so into /usr/lib/mozilla-firefox/plugins but when i look through the list of firefox plugins it still has flash 9.0
you may need to remove the old plugins
straight from the directory or do i just disable it in firefox and then reboot firefox
you will need to restart firefox
wais so do i disable the flash 9.0 plugin and then restart?
yes
not working: i still ahve flashplayer 9.0 disabled and no new flash player. did i move it to the right directory even?
are you using adobe's flash 10?
flash 9 may still be in other directories
i downloaded and isntalled it but firefox doesnt use it. how do i totally remove flash 9 and put flash 10 in its place?
look for the other instances of libflashplayer.so.  Try using locate libflashplayer.so
mouseclone: i replaced every instance of libflashplayer.so and it worked! thanks!
